org.apache.felix.ipojo.extender.queue

Interface QueueService

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    LifecycleQueueService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractQueueService, EnforcedQueueService, ExecutorQueueService, ForwardingQueueService, PreferenceQueueService, SynchronousQueueService

    public interface QueueService
    Definition of the queue service. The queue service is used to enqueue the bundle processing job. The processing order is depending of the implementation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      Synchronous queue mode.

    • Method Detail

      • getFinished

        int getFinished()
        Returns:
        the number of jobs that have been executed entirely (including successful and erroneous jobs).

      • getWaiters

        int getWaiters()
        Returns:
        the number of jobs scheduled but not yet started.

      • getCurrents

        int getCurrents()
        Returns:
        the number of jobs currently executed (started but not finished).

      • getWaitersInfo

        List<JobInfo> getWaitersInfo()
        Returns:
        a snapshot of the currently waiting jobs.

      • submit

        <T> Future<T> submit(Job<T> callable,
                     Callback<T> callback,
                     String description)
        Submits a job to the queue service.
        Parameters:
        callable - the job
        callback - callback called when the job is processed
        description - a description of the job
        Returns:
        the future object to retrieve the result
